page.title: 10A RETIRING TEACHER
page.content:
I was born in Bournemouth. My parents came from the Midlands. I lived in Springbourne and went to St Clements' school. My school uniform included a hat, two pairs of shoes, one for indoor and one for outside. One pair was left in the cloakroom all day. I don't think they would be there today when you got back! I hated sport, I didn't think there was any need to do sports. Our games skirts had to be exactly two inches from the ground when we nelt down. You cannot imagine that today, girls have so many choices. This is certainly a different age where children join in adults conversations where as in my day we might have to sit still for two hours without interrupting.
Sara Thorley, Kelly Ward, Tina Bondsfield
